struct  DataFormatDataSource

Detailed Description

The AudioPlayerStore is used for the registration and configuration of the available AudioPlayers.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

AudioPlayerStore::AudioPlayerStore (   )  [protected]
 

AudioPlayerStore::~AudioPlayerStore (   ) 
 

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN AudioPlayerStore::AddPlayer (  AudioPlayer *  player  ) 
 

Adds a player to the store. The order of adding the players reflects their default priority: The player which is added first has the highest priority. (first in - first out)

Parameters:
player The player to be added.
Returns:
Indicates, if the player was successfully added to the store.

BOOLEAN AudioPlayerStore::ExcludePlayer (  AudioPlayer *  player,
MimeType  type,
AudioReference::SoundDataSource  source
) 
 

Allows to exclude a player for a concrete format and data source. Please note, that this method should only be called after the players are added to the store. Calling this method removes the player from the prioritized list of players for the given format and data source.

Parameters:
player The player which has to be excluded.
type The format for which the player has to be excluded.
source The data source for which the player has to be excluded.
Returns:
Indicates, if the priorization was successful.

AudioPlayerStore * AudioPlayerStore::GetInstance (   )  [static]
 

BOOLEAN AudioPlayerStore::PrioritizePlayer (  AudioPlayer *  player,
MimeType  type,
AudioReference::SoundDataSource  source
) 
 

Allows to change the default priority of players for a concrete format and data source. Please note, that this method should only be called after the players are added to the store. Calling this method gives the player the highest priority for the given format and data source. (last in - first out)

Parameters:
player The player whose priority has to be changed.
type The format for which the player has to be prioritized.
source The data source for which the player has to be prioritized.
Returns:
Indicates, if the priorization was successful.
